As to what pertains to this eighth verse now under con- sideration, in it he effects two things. 1. After his dissua- sion from carnal vices which render men infamous among all the sober and prudent, he dissuades also from all spiri- tual ones, which are deemed lighter faults, which are not accounted as vices among the generality. 2. He enumer- ates some expressly, that from these it may be understood that others of the same kind are to be condemned and abandoned.
